lexUnit.name: scan.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look at quickly in order to identify relevant features or information.

sentence.text: This index was started by Herbarium staff , who scanned new journals and books coming in to the Library .

It is important for school librarians to scan computer journals , obtain information from publishers and other sources , arrange exhibit of software in the school or provide loan copies of software from school library service .
Renwick scanned the list .
Scanning the lists of officers , Sly was struck by the number of times each name occurred , but in a different post .
Tallboy scanned the list of people from whom statements had been taken .
Steven , who was scanning the menu , froze .
She scanned the newspapers for offers of adoption , of which there were many .
While the kettle is boiling he scans the front page .
As soon as she was safely past the shuffling fraternity , she opened her own newspaper and rapidly scanned the front page .
A good deal of research has been done to show how most people tend to scan advertisement pages in newspapers and magazines .
The possibility that future generations will read our textbooks with about as much comprehension as we might scan a Renaissance text on the cabbala is rather unnerving .
Before getting off the bed , Mungo scanned the books to see what reading matter Vic preferred .
Depending on personal preference , the user can scan the print-out for errors or amendments needed in wording or layout or , without printing the document , can view what has been written on screen .
I scanned the paper for news .
If we had an index at the front of the book we could scan the index for the name and then turn to the appropriate page .
He picked up the correspondence and miscellaneous papers in the in-tray and quickly scanned the contents .

He scanned the print , seeing that it echoed more or less exactly the story Swansborough had just told him , then turned his attention to the photograph alongside -- three people , obviously dressed for leisure .
Beaming , Caroline scanned the rest of the letter .
Its pages were scanned with eagle eyes .
Lindsey scanned the report and raised one eyebrow .
` She 'd have a lot to get used to at first , " Rose said absently as she scanned through the letter .
